page.title: 03THE CITY HALL, BRADFORD
page.content: The {City Hall }in Bradford was completed in Sept l873 to competition winning designs by the Bradford architects {Lockwood & Mawson. }The style is 'gothic revival'using details originally developed in the 13thC. At second floor level there are {35 {statues of all the Kings and Queens {from William I to Victoria. Built of local stone obtained from the Cliffe Wood Quarries in Bolton Road, it was {extended in 1909 }to provide a great deal of much needed extra office space, a larger Council Chamber, a Banqueting Hall, and more accommodation for the Lord Mayor. The{clock-tower of the City Hall is a {copy of the tower of the Palazzo {Vecchio in Florence.}The building cost Â£100,000 to build and furnish. It used to house the local Court rooms now situated in building nearby.
